#include <iostream>

#include <stack>

using namespace std;

  

const int NUM_DISKS = 3;

stack<int> towers[3];

int moves = 0;

  

void moveDisk(int from, int to) {

Â  Â  int disk = towers[from].top();

Â  Â  towers[from].pop();

Â  Â  towers[to].push(disk);

Â  Â  moves++;

Â  Â  cout << "Move disk " << disk << " from tower " << from+1 << " to tower " << to+1 << endl;

}

  
  
  

void printTowers() {

Â  Â  for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) {

Â  Â  Â  Â  cout << "Tower " << i+1 << ": ";

Â  Â  Â  Â  stack<int> tower = towers[i];

Â  Â  Â  Â  while (!tower.empty()) {

Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  cout << tower.top() << " ";

Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  tower.pop();

Â  Â  Â  Â  }

Â  Â  Â  Â  cout << endl;

Â  Â  }

}

  

int main()

{

  

Â  Â  for (int i = NUM_DISKS; i > 0; i--) {

Â  Â  Â  Â  towers[0].push(i);

Â  Â  }

  

Â  Â  int from, to;

Â  Â  cout << "Tower of Hanoi innit " << endl;

Â  Â  cout << "Enter the number of the tower you want to move a disk from," << endl;

Â  Â  cout << "followed by the number of the tower you want to move the disk to." << endl;

  

Â  Â  while (towers[2].size() != NUM_DISKS) {

Â  Â  Â  Â  printTowers();

Â  Â  Â  Â  cout << "Moves made: " << moves << endl;

Â  Â  Â  Â  cout << "Enter the tower to move disk from: ";

Â  Â  Â  Â  cin >> from;

Â  Â  Â  Â  cout << "Enter the tower to move disk to: ";

Â  Â  Â  Â  cin >> to;

Â  Â  Â  Â  if(from < 1 || from > 3 || to < 1 || to > 3) cout << "Invalid input, Please enter between 1-3" << endl;

Â  Â  Â  Â  else if(towers[from-1].empty()) cout << "No disk in this tower!" << endl;

Â  Â  Â  Â  else if(!towers[to-1].empty() && towers[from-1].top() > towers[to-1].top()) cout << "Can't put bigger disk on top of smaller disk!" << endl;

Â  Â  Â  Â  else moveDisk(from-1, to-1);

Â  Â  }

  

Â  Â  cout << "You have successfully completed the game in " << moves << " moves!" << endl;

Â  Â  cout<<"Big brain person can do it in just a single move tho"<<endl;

Â  Â  return 0;

}
;
